intro: Efossus dichroacanthus, commonly known as the double-spined spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, clustered yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Due to its toxic latex, it requires caution when handling.
